reports.label: No substantive inconsistencies or underspecification in Section 2 terminology handling
reports.explanation: The analysis indicates that Section 2 correctly installs the BCP 14 boilerplate and accurately reuses DRIP terms from earlier RFCs without introducing inconsistencies or underspecifications.
justification: The excerpt summary explains that Section 2 sets up terminology by providing the BCP 14 normative-keyword boilerplate and listing reused DRIP terms from RFCs 9153, 9434, and 9374 (E1).
Candidate Issue 1 explicitly states that there are no substantive inconsistencies or underspecifications in the handling of Section 2 terminology (E2).

snippets.text: Excerpt Summary: Section 2 of RFC 9886 sets up terminology: it provides the BCP 14 normative-keyword boilerplate and lists which existing DRIP terms from earlier RFCs (9153, 9434, 9374) are reused in this document.

Issue 1:
    Type: None
    Label: No substantive inconsistencies or underspecification in Section 2 terminology handling
    Relevant Dimensions: 
    Sketch: Section 2 correctly installs the BCP 14 boilerplate and clearly states that it reuses a subset of te...

summary: (E1) Section 2 is described as setting up terminology with the appropriate BCP 14 boilerplate and referencing earlier RFCs for DRIP terms.
(E2) Candidate Issue 1 confirms there are no substantive inconsistencies or underspecifications in the handling of Section 2 terminology.

reports.severity_basis: All evaluated dimensions (Temporal, ActorDirectionality, Scope, etc.) are LOW and no error is detected, as confirmed by the candidate issue.
